DOC.brief_summary: The Cesarean Section Optimal Antibiotic Prophylaxis ( C/SOAP ) study large pragmatic multi-center randomize clinical trial design evaluate comparative effectiveness safety azithromycin-based extended-spectrum antibiotic prophylaxis ( azithromycin plus standard narrow-spectrum cephalosporin ) relative standard single-agent cephalosporin ( preferably prior surgical incision ) prevent post-cesarean infection . Hypothesis : Compared narrow-spectrum prophylaxis ( i.e . cefazolin alone , clindamycin cephalosporin allergy ) prior surgical incision , addition extended-spectrum prophylaxis ( azithromycin + cefazolin ) reduce incidence post-cesarean infection .
